Description: Bright blue glazed composition scarab: engraved on the base in three registers. In the upper register is the lower end of a cartouche containing the name of a king. Behind the cartouche appear the legs of a bird, possibly a falcon. In the lower register is Horus as a bird-headed human presenting the 'wʒs'-sceptre to Sekhmet(?); another lion or cat-headed goddess stands behind Horus holding a flower on a long stalk. Very intricate design in a small space. Hole pierced through longitudinally. Section of base chipped away.
Bibliographic references: Giveon R 1985a / Egyptian scarabs from Western Asia from the collections of the British Museum (p.186, no.31)
Condition: Fair; incomplete?; section chipped away from base.
